attributes.action: Enforce a minimum of 6 weeks Statutory Paternity Leave to all fathers at 90% pay
attributes.background: Fathers currently take 2 weeks paternity leave when their child is born. Mothers are entitled to 52 weeks (39 weeks paid Statutory). Fathers should spend the first 6 weeks with their babies & partners for support & bonding. Paternity leave should change to minimum 6 weeks at 90% of their salary.

attributes.action: Ensure fracking is not allowed near Sherwood Forest
attributes.background:
Following a Guardian article (see link below) we would like to ensure that Ineos and any other company is not allowed to begin fracking near the historic site of the Major Oak in Sherwood Forest. 

(https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/01/robin-hoods-sherwood-forest-faces-fracking-threat)

attributes.action: Abolish TV Licencing and Increase National Insurance
attributes.background:
The NHS is funded by N. I. which is proportional to earnings.
The BBC is funded by a Licence Fee which costs a minimum of Â£145 a year.

People are being forced to pay for a non-essential service while an essential one is in dire need of extra funding. 

We must cut off the BBC to save the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
How much the BBC demand:
https://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/pay-for-your-tv-licence/payment-methods/direct-debit-pay1

How much the NHS needs: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/20/nhs-in-england-reveals-245bn-record-deficit

How much the BBC gets:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/annualreport/2014/executive/finances/licence_fee.html

attributes.action: Leave the clocks on British Summer Time all year round.
attributes.background: Light evenings in the summer are widely enjoyed but it is a little depressing when the hours of daylight begin to shorten. Then there is the sudden jolt of even earlier darkness when the clocks go back one hour. Why not leave the clocks alone and allow gradual acceptance of the shorter days?
attributes.additional_details: It has been done before (1968 to 1971) and it has been debated many times. With the UK leaving the EU there will be no European requirement for a common summer time but, in effect, summer time would not be changed anyway. If businesses wish to keep in step with their international partners it should be easy enough for them to change their trading hours to suit; a side-effect of this could be to stagger business hours thus reducing rush-hour congestion and pollution. In areas such as northern Scotland where all-year BST would mean a mid-morning sunrise in the winter months surely it is not beyond the wit of men and women to adjust working hours as appropriate. Alternatively they could learn to live with it as do millions of people in other northern locations.

attributes.action: Demand easy re-registration of British-registered vehicles in other EU countries
attributes.background: British citizens re-registering their vehicles abroad (in the EU) are experienced serious and costly administrative obstruction, or being refused. Vehicles presented in EU states with accompanying V5C that states the vehicle's EC Type Approval Number should be allowed easy and low-cost registration.
attributes.additional_details:
A core principle of the EU is freedom of movement of citizens and labour. Migrating citizens' vehicles should be easy to re-register in EU states if the registrant presents an EC Type Approval Number as printed on the UK V5C. This number proves EU-wide road conformity for the vehicle.

This is supported by  EC directive 2007/C68/04 which states that a vehicle already registered in a member state should not be tested again on the same criteria at re-registration or have to undergo further tests.

attributes.action: Give free public transport to homeless people in UK
attributes.background: Whilst we find ways and seek solutions to Homelessness it would be a good start by offering access to public transport. This way we would offer them some respite and support that they need in order to improve their lives. Moreover, it would not cost us much as it is already there.
attributes.additional_details:
In the current climate Homelessness is rising and there are no easy solutions to this. Local Authorities are struggling to cope with the demand and are not able to house most people registered as Homeless due to the lack of Housing supply.

We believe that it would be only just fair that as a great country, United Kingdom would allow anyone who is registered as Homeless to have free public transport. This would enable them to go to work, attend job centres, hospital or housing appointments.

attributes.action: Ban fireworks outside of events on specific days across the UK.
attributes.background:
In the weeks around Bonfire Night, fireworks are constantly being let off causing nothing but worry for pet owners. 

The noise and vibrations from fireworks can cause severe distress in both wild and domestic animals, meaning that owners have to take steps to alleviate their distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Bonfire 'Night' is often spread over a fortnight. This means that owners can find it difficult to plan for their animals. Fireworks have caused distress to all kinds of animals, not just cats and dogs. Smaller animals, such as rabbits, and farm animals, such as horses, can be affected too. 

This petition is calling for the government to specify days of the year on which the use of fireworks is legal, e.g. 5th November, 31st December, Diwali, and to ban their use outside of these dates.

attributes.action: Increase awareness and services for those suffering from eating disorders
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask that the government both develop greater awareness and increase funding to mental health services for those suffering from an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of students from the University of Exeter campaigning to raise awareness of the lack of support for sufferers of eating disorders, particularly in the South West.

attributes.action: Ensure that students from year7 are taught in schools how to detect child abuse.
attributes.background: We're a group of students that believe that child abuse needs to be reduced. We have found astonishing figures that kids 4 years old and under are most affected. Most kids that have been physically, verbally or sexually abused are unaware that they are being abused as they don't understand the signs
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 5 children die every day because of child abuse and 1 out of 3 girls and 1 out of 5 boys will be sexually abused before they reach age 18.
For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering alone

attributes.action: Overturn Chris Grayling's plan to create a road tunnel under Stonehenge on A303
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a World Heritage Site, famous worldwide. It is also a Part of OUR heritage and a Sacred Site to the Druids. The plan could cause irreparable damage to the site and cause it to be lost to future generations forever.
attributes.additional_details:
Last year, the historians Dan Snow and Tom Holland attacked the proposals, likening them to vandals destroying ancient artefacts. âWe have recently started to realise that the standing stones are just a beginning. They sit at the heart of the worldâs most significant and best-preserved stone-age landscape. The governmentâs plans endanger this unique site,â he said. 
Holland said: âThere is so much waiting to be learned about how Stonehenge was built â if we decide, as a country, not to sacrifice it to road building. The battle to save our most significant neolithic landscape is an unending one.â

attributes.action: Ban plastic staws or introduce a 5p charge for each one.
attributes.background: To help cut down on the amount of single use disposable plastics. As whether they are put in the bin or thrown on the floor the toxic chemicals still leak into our oceans and damage/kill marine life.

attributes.action: Allow all emergency services to use spit hoods!
attributes.background: Several infectious diseases are contained in saliva, I wish this subject to be discussed in Parliament and come down on the side of all emergency services.

attributes.action: Ensure plastic food packaging, plates and cutlery are environmentally friendly.
attributes.background:
France has passed a new law to ensure all plastic cups, cutlery and plates are compostable and made of biologically-sourced materials.
The UK should be making plans to implement similar plastics and packaging controls in order to tackle the growing problems of pollution and climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
By 2050 there will be more plastic in our oceans than fish (World Economic Forum). Nearly a third of all plastics leak into the environment where they end up eaten by wildlife or in floating rubbish dumps in the sea.
The British government needs to take some kind of definitive action against the use of plastics in our country, if weâre going to have any chance of mitigating the problem of waste in a growing global population.

attributes.action: Stop prescribing medicines such as Paracetamol on the NHS!
attributes.background: The NHS spent Â£87.6 million pounds last year on paracetamol tablets which can be bought 20 times cheaper in a supermarket. Doctors wrote 22.9 million prescriptions at an average cost of Â£3.83. These painkillers can be bought in supermarkets for as little as 19p!!!!
attributes.additional_details: Let us all do out bit and let us help the NHS put its funding to better use. Lets stop prescribing medicines for common colds which can be bought so cheaply and freely in any supermarket or corner shop!

attributes.action: Public enquiry over the last decade regarding social service/cafcass failings
attributes.background:
The failings of both social services/cafcass
And reluctance to follow up on detrimental information their reluctance to participate this alienated parents and their dismissal of information
attributes.additional_details: Information can be supplied by various groups

attributes.action: Throw out plans requiring voters to produce ID at polling stations
attributes.background: The UK government has announced plans to trial asking voters to produce ID before being allowed to vote. If this law was to be passed then it will be unfairly affecting the poor, the marginalised, the homeless, the isolated and the most vulnerable sections of our society. It needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Require packaging to state that a product has been tested on animals
attributes.background: We are petitioning for products to advertise their use or lack of cruelty-free testing as a requirement. This allows buyers to make an informed decision on products and their ethics.
attributes.additional_details: Over 3 million animals are tested on each year and many of these tests are unnecessary. The bulk of testing can be carried out digitally and therefore this cruelty to animals is unneeded.

attributes.action: State Pension Payable Immediately On Completion Of 40 Years N.I. Contributions
attributes.background: Recent State Pension changes means many people will contribute around 50 years N.I contributions before they will receive a State Pension, despite the Government themselves saying 35 years is the amount of contributions needed to create it in the first place.     Pay the pension at 40 years maximum.
attributes.additional_details: If your employer say they will pay you Â£10 per hour for a fifty hour week, then you only receive Â£350, you'd feel a little more than a little miffed - but that's exactly the "deal" we are being sold by the Government with increased retirement ages.     By their own admission, you need to pay N.I. contributions for 35 years to get a full State Pension.     So why are we expected to work longer?     Any individual completing 40 years contributions should have their pension payable from that point.

attributes.action: Stop passport checks on pregnant NHS patients
attributes.background: The proposals by St. George's University Hospital Trust, and backed by the Home Office, that pregnant people would be subject to mandatory passport checks before being able to access care to crack down on "health tourism" are deeply worrying, steeped in racism, and should be rejected immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal wards already require a form with proof of eligibility but these cannot always be done fully. The proposals would require checks to be stricter and could, in the view of multiple critics and medical staff, lead to higher risk to patient health. These proposals give no assurance that patients would have access to care regardless of immigration status, as is current government policy and law. Focus on "health tourism" is a racist smokescreen for the Conservatives' destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: I propose a referendum to Ban the Burqa in public to be set into UK law
attributes.background: Due to governments once again not listening to the people who elect them I propose you hold a referendum to ban the burqa in all public spaces.  Let the people decide the fate / destiny of our country rather than politically correct politicians worried about being re-elected.
attributes.additional_details: https://yougov.co.uk/news/2016/08/31/majority-public-backs-burka-ban/

attributes.action: Abolish employment tribunal fees.
attributes.background: We call on the Conservative Government to abolish tribunal fees which were introduced in 2013 which are severely hindering access to justice especially for those who are vulnerable.

attributes.action: Stop horses and cyclists using roads with higher than 30mph speed limits
attributes.background: As a car enthusiast who uses social media a lot and also having freinds with horses and a few who cycle I see a lot of posts arguing about safety on the roads. I think the simplest place to start is to keep both horses and cyclists in lower speed limit areas reducing the risk of accidents hopefully.

attributes.action: Stop free interpreters in the NHS.
attributes.background: Free interpreters are costing the NHS more than Â£23 million per year. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: For schools to teach children ages 6-15 the mental damage bullying can do.
attributes.background:
Bullying- some school's have excellent policies for it where as some don't.
Bullying is becoming more viral on the internet and social networks.
Although they may get punished somehow for this do they actually realise what they are doing to that person mentally?
attributes.additional_details:
Educating children in schools the effects bullying has on a person's mental health and how it will effect their future.
When you are young you don't realise what you are doing you just think your the cool hard kid wanting everyone's attention, therefor not thinking about what you are doing to that person.
So making it part of a weekly lesson can help children understand that bullying will effect people in later life and also effect their schooling and education.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS wasting more time in the courts: Commission PrEP immediately.
attributes.background: PrEP stands for Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis. It's a course of HIV drugs for HIV negative people to take before sex to reduce their risk of contracting HIV. Research demonstrates that PrEP is as effective as condoms in preventing HIV transmission.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2016 NHS England stated that they were 'not responsible for commissioning PrEPâ. Following a legal challenge from the National AIDS Trust, which the NHS wasted time and money appealing, the Court of Appeal has ruled that the NHS has the legal power to fund PrEP. 

The NHSâs decision has already been delayed for over 6 months, so we urgently call on Jeremy Hunt to make PrEP available on the NHS. 

Every day the NHS delays its decision, 17 more people will be diagnosed with HIV.

attributes.action: Form a Home or National Defence Force of HM Forces Veterans.
attributes.background: There are thousands of able and willing HM Forces Veterans who would step forward if required to form a Home or National Defence Force to assist in Border Protection or assistance to Police and regular Forces in times of emergency, or civil unrest.
attributes.additional_details: These Veterans are a valuable asset to this Nation, well trained, experienced and able to fulfill tasks and roles during times of emergency or civil unrest.

attributes.action: Stop the super-rich avoiding tax: set a Â£40 million cap on money put into trusts
attributes.background: The super-rich can put limitless assets into trusts so that their beneficiaries pay only a fraction of the taxes they would otherwise owe.  We've seen this recently with the 7th Duke of Westminster, who will avoid paying Â£3.6 billion inheritance tax.  A Â£40 million cap would stop this.
attributes.additional_details: It's not illegal for the super-rich to put these assets into trusts but it deprives the Treasury of significant income.   The 7th Duke's unpaid contribution could have built 40 hospitals (at Â£90 million per hospital, including equipment and infrastructure) and would have represented almost 80% of the total inheritance tax paid to HMRC in 2015-16.  The Â£40 million cap is based on the BBC's figure (January 2015) that to join the super-rich you need to be worth $50-$100 million.

attributes.action: Halt Brexit process & seek legally binding mandate from public post-Trump
attributes.background: The recent change in the US government administration and their subsequent rhetoric and actions have placed the UK in a perilous negotiating position during the Brexit process. Reality of Brexit is also more well defined than pre-referendum meaning public opinion may have changed significantly.
attributes.additional_details: Following the election of Mr. Trump and the subsequent change in US government administration, the US has changed position on numerous issues, with controversy following certain actions too numerous to mention here. We are specifically concerned with where this leaves the UK in our Brexit negotiations given HM Government's timetable for withdrawal, in light of the overwhelming disquiet shown over aligning ourselves with the new US administration against the relative stability of EU membership.

attributes.action: Urge Volkswagen to compensate owners of cars with emission defeat devices
attributes.background: In the US, Volkswagen have to pay $5100 to each owner affected and the owners get the option of buyback by Volkswagen of the vehicle or to wait for VW to develope a fix that can win regulatory approval.
attributes.additional_details: Emission "defeat devices" are a software Volkswagen knowingly installed in its cars to fool emission testing machines into thinking that the car is safer than it is. The software actually allows the cars affected to emit up to 40 times the legally allowable pollution, whilst cheating at the MOT emission test so that it passes. The scandal has also damaged the resale value of affected cars and as such I think it a travesty that Volkswagen do not pay compensation to owners

attributes.action: Extend the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to include crustaceans
attributes.background:
Crustaceans are not covered by existing animal welfare legislation. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 states that its protection can be extended to other types of animals if it can be proven that they are capable of experiencing pain.
Scientific evidence proves that crustaceans do feel pain.
attributes.additional_details:
There is much scientific evidence to suggest that crustaceans feel pain.
As crustaceans are not in the animal welfare act, they can be killed in any way. This usually involves boiling them or hacking them to pieces whilst they are still alive. 
Animal welfare organisations are calling for greater protection for these animals, based on sound scientific evidence and the provision in the Act.
Reference: RSPCA, Animal Aid and Shellfish network

attributes.action: Change UK licensing laws to allow drug testing in nightclubs.
attributes.background: Despite current laws, 1 in 5 young adults used illicit drugs last year, of unknown purity and strength and have been attributed to the deaths of 50 people in 2014, a trend which is increasing. By allowing safe drug tests in venues, users will be aware of the composition and lives could be saved.
attributes.additional_details: Drug testing has been used in Europe and at UK festivals with Police and PHA support. There needs to be a debate on how this can be implemented across the night time industry so that it's customers can be as informed as they are with alcohol choices. The tragedy of these deaths is conversely having an impact on that economy. There were a further 14000 hospital admissions which is additional burden on the NHS. Statistics: http://digital.nhs.uk/catalogue/PUB21159/drug-misu-eng-2016-rep.pdf

attributes.action: Allow parliament to vote on whether or not we stay within the single market
attributes.background: People voted for brexit thinking it would be done in an orderly fashion with an input from everyone in parliament, not by a committee created by an unelected prime minister. Brexit should be done with everyone in mind, no one asked for a crippled pound and a damage to the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The European Single Market enables free trade within the EU, helping 26 million UK businesses and access to a market worth over Â£9 trillion. Membership of the single market would allow us to enjoy the same trade benefits and support British companies even after we have left the EU. Continued tariff-free trade will preserve confidence in the British economy, but with Theresa May's current plan, it would require leaving the block, our economy will go down and the working/middle class will suffer.

attributes.action: The derogatory term 'Kufar' used to describe 'Non Muslims' should be banned.
attributes.background: We are constantly reminded of what is 'Politically correct' when discussing anything to do with Islam. We find the word used against us by some members of the Islamic faith totally unacceptable and offensive. Other faiths should  be regarded with the same respect that the followers of Islam expect.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3751080/The-face-hatred-unveiled-Wife-jailed-Choudary-clearly-identified-time-vows-non-Muslims-Britain-destroyed.html
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DsG9yQrdD4

http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Kuffar

The people are tired of the British Government having a 'Two tier' system. We should all be respected equally. We have a right to be treated equally . Allowing this derogatory term to be used in public should be treated as a hate crime.

attributes.action: Make breeding animals without a licence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Each year "ALMOST 50,000 pet dogs are being dumped by owners in Britain every year â with healthy animals being exterminated every TWO hours by agencies who are struggling to cope".  "Authorities killed 5,142 stray dogs last year as Britain's abandoned pet crisis shows little sign of being solved".
attributes.additional_details: If animals weren't so readily available to buy on the internet/private sales, if demand was far greater than the supply thus prices weren't so competitive/affordable then people wouldn't be so quick to buy one and be so irresponsible and careless once they become pet owners.  I would like licensed breeders ONLY to sell pets in order for the government to have better control over the pet population/welfare,  and a better approach to who animals are sold to, some form of vetting would be ideal.

attributes.action: To excempt special guardians from this ruthless benefit cap.
attributes.background: Special guardians protect vulnerable children and often cannot work due to caring for these children saving them from foster care, saving the system thousands.This benefit cap is heartless towards many children and (previously looked after children and the families who care for them.  STOP THIS CAP!
attributes.additional_details: Guardians are excempt from this cap but not special guardians.... guardians are guardians both are raising children until 18 and both situations very traumatic for these children and being raised and cared for by others not birth parents. The new welfare reform has financially put us at risk! The goverment say work or we cut your money! Many can't work and have had to give up employment as many of these children have issues and need us. Should special guardians be going to A FOOD BANK??

attributes.action: Regulate all Online Animal Rescue Groups
attributes.background: After a bad experience with an online animal rescue group, who illegally re-homed my cat, I learned of others who had difficulties with them. Animal suffering was also suggested. Anyone can set up an online rescue group; there are no premises; they need no licence; the RSPCA  find it hard to inspect
attributes.additional_details:
Animal Welfare legislation is out  of date:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare-legislation-protecting-pets 
There is no legislation or governing body to check online rescue groups.
People need no prior animal rescue knowledge or experience to start a group. 
Immediately a group is set up they can ask for donations regardless of whether they are a registered charity or not. The groups are not accountable to anyone and nor are their financial records.
Many start off with good intent but cannot cope when they are inundated with animals and have a lack of funding.

attributes.action: Legally define a single agreed definition for âvegetarianâ or âveganâ.
attributes.background: Currently there is no single agreed definition for âvegetarianâ or âveganâ. This makes it difficult to legally require food businesses to provide information on the suitability of their products for vegetarian and vegan consumers.
attributes.additional_details: A previous petition was raised to make labeling food as vegetarian and/or vegan as a legal requirement, as many companies refuse to label their products as Vegetarian or vegan. A simple legal requirement for a label, would assist thousands of consumers to make smart choices.  The government's response confirmed that no single agreed definition makes it difficult to legally require food businesses to provide labeling.  A legal definition will assist in changing this.

attributes.action: Give the CQC powers to regulate & inspect all Care recruitment agencies
attributes.background: Recruitment in care is becoming a huge issue, every provider now has a problem with agency use. There are enough staff out there but they are working for agencies rather than the regulated Care Homes and Hospitals. It is not a level playing field and staff are drawn to agencies that break the rules.
attributes.additional_details: Agencies don't have to register with the CQC if where they work is already registered. Staff are drawn to agency work as they employ immediately, often without DBS checks & let them work excessive hours in different homes. If we challenge them then they are just moved to another home. We as managers have to use them to fill gaps in our staffing but we wouldn't need to if they played by the same rules and staff were not drawn to quick unregulated employment. Charles G Sadler - Registered Manager

attributes.action: Recognise non-binary people legally
attributes.background: We would like those who identify as non-binary, genderqueer, gender non conforming, or any other similar identity to be recognised in the eyes of British law.
attributes.additional_details: Recognising us legally means that the discrimination against non binary individuals will be reduced, as anti-discriminatory laws can be enforced to prosecute people illegally targeting us- this will also act as a deterrent for other people who discriminate on the grounds of gender identity and expression.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to pay Govia Thameslink Railway Â£20m of Taxpayer Money
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) has been granted a Â£20m fund to "get to grips" with problems on the Southern rail network.

GTR is jointly owned by Go-Ahead (2/3) and Keolis (1/3), who between them also hold the Southeastern and London Midland franchises.
attributes.additional_details:
On 2nd September 2016, Go-Ahead announced full-year profits (y/e 2nd July 2016) of Â£99.8m, an increase of 26.8% over the previous financial year.

Parliament should debate whether the payment of Â£20m can be justified in light of the demonstrated profitability of Go-Ahead, or whether a private enterprise should fund the improvements to its service from cash on deposit and profits.

If GTR cannot or will not fund the improvements to services, it should consider resigning its franchises.

attributes.action: Make chronic stomach/bowel conditions eligible for a disabled person's railcard
attributes.background: Many people who suffer from chronic stomach/bowel illnesses such as inflammatory bowel disease and irritable bowel syndrome will opt to use trains for long distance journeys, due to their accessible toilets, on demand. Due to the need for accessible toilets, we ask that sufferers receive a discount.
attributes.additional_details: Toilets are a major necessity for people who suffer from stomach/bowel conditions as they can be urgently needed at any time during a journey. This can prevent people from driving long journeys as service stations can often be few and far between. We ask that the government add chronic stomach/bowel illnesses to the list of conditions eligible for a disabled persons railcard. In some cases, people will choose a train journey instead of long car journeys to avoid embarrassment, anxiety and pain.

attributes.action: Abolish the Human Rights Act.
attributes.background: We believe that the Human Rights Act should be abolished.  For too long, it has been used as a criminals charter to escape justice and deportation by using the right to family life.  It is high time the Government acted and abolished this pernicious Act.

attributes.action: Government to debate epilepsy in 2017. We all need HM Government help.
attributes.background: We need MPs help to get epilepsy recognised and recognised in schools. Employers to understand and to place us all in jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
To date teachers, employees and the majority of the public fail to recognise what epilepsy is and how to deal with it. 

We are normal everyday people who in suffer from an illness. Please give us a chance in life.

attributes.action: More NHS funding in mental health for armed forces veterans suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: Many armed forces veterans are faced with harrowing and distressing circumstances in the line of duty.Organisations such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling to Lancashire armed forces Veterans and are not funded appropriately.Veterans need our support.
attributes.additional_details: Services such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling for armed forces veterans.In order to survive they need to be funded appropriately.This year they were given Â£20,000 less than the previous year and yet have a greater demand and an expanding waiting list.The demand for these services is high and the funding is lacking.Support our brave soldiers in the aftercare they deserve.

attributes.action: Start teaching children in schools about mental health
attributes.background:
In schools children are taught about sex education but never about mental health - why not? 

Large percentages of the population are affected by mental illness themselves or are subject to it some way. Make sure people are aware of warning signs/symptoms from a young age in order to help others.
attributes.additional_details: 10% of children and young people (aged 5-16 years) have a clinically diagnosable mental problem, yet 70% of children and adolescents who experience mental health problems have not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. (https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/statistics/mental-health-statistics-children-and-young-people)

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for restaurants to clearly label vegan options.
attributes.background: It's commonplace for vegetarian options in restaurants to be clearly labelled, but can be rather difficult to determine which options are vegan, and can lead to lengthy research and awkward conversations. I feel it's necessary as vegetarians can eat all vegan food but not vice-versa.

attributes.action: Make inquests fair - Widen the legal aid scope for families attending inquests
attributes.background: The current system for providing legal representation for families at inquests is unfair and imbalanced. The current system allows public bodies legal representation, usually at public expense. Families are left without similar access & strict tests in exceptional cases for   obtaining legal aid.

attributes.action: Condemn Donald Trump's ban on Muslim refugees and immigrants.
attributes.background: Donald Trump has signed an executive order to close Americaâs borders to Muslim refugees and immigrants from Iraq, Syria, Iran, Yemen, Sudan, Libya and Somalia.This is even being applied to green card residents. We must use our influence to condemn this deeply divisive move.

attributes.action: Keep RAF Halton open
attributes.background: The MOD are considering fully shutting down RAF Halton by 2022. Although this is in line with the ''Better Defence Estate' Strategy, which aims to contribute to the government's housing target, this site contains some on the UK's best RAF memorabilia and it would be a a shame to see this place gone.
attributes.additional_details: http://forces.tv/48967067

attributes.action: Ensure the Royal Navy does not lose its long-range anti-ship missile capability
attributes.background:
The MoD has admitted that the Royal Navy's Harpoon anti-ship missile will go out of service in 2018 with no replacement specified. The shorter range Sea Skua missile also goes out of service, not to be replaced until 2020.

This means the Royal Navy will lack a ship-killing capability for sometime
attributes.additional_details:
Rear-Adml Chris Parry, said: "It's a significant capability gap and the Government is being irresponsible. It just shows that our warships are for the shop windowÂ and not for fighting."

Lord West of Spithead, a former First Sea Lord, said:Â âThis is just another example of where the lack of money is squeezing and making the nation less safe. We will have this gap of several years without missiles. Well, thatâs fine if you donât have to fight anybody in the meantime.â
